cmCourseInfo.description: The nature and justification of legal rules as preparation for the study of basic principles of law governing the relations between individual citizens, and the relations between individual citizens and the state. A selection of contract, tort, criminal and administrative law. Restricted to students in the major program Ethics, Society, and Law.
cmCourseInfo.title: Basic Principles of Law
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: Active in ASMAJ1618 only if enrolling in the Fall/Winter session. A student must be in third or fourth year.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
This is an online, asynchronous course. All lectures will be posted on Quercus at the beginning of the course. Students will have the opportunity to participate in eight synchronous online webinar Q&A sessions (days/times set out in the syllabus) and to have one-on-one office hours with the professor by telephone appointment. Students need the ability to use Quercus, Zoom and 10to8 and to record and upload audio or video recordings.

cmCourseInfo.description: A one semester research experience abroad. Students participate in a research project under the mentorship of a faculty supervisor in the host institution and gain experience of working and living abroad.
cmCourseInfo.title: International Experience I

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
For E-indicator courses: contact Kiran Sahota, Room 300, Larkin Building, Monday to Friday from 9:00am-12:00pm and 2:00-5:00pm, at 416-978-8454 or artsdean@trinity.utoronto.ca. Please note that this course is only open to students who have been awarded the Queen Elizabeth II Scholarship.

courses.name: Selected Topics in Ethics, Society, and Law

cmCourseInfo.description: The course examines a set of selected topics in ethics, society, and law. The topics will be based on the research interests of an individual instructor. Both the topics and the instructor may change with each offering of the course, and the course is not expected to be offered every year.
cmCourseInfo.title: Selected Topics in Ethics, Society, and Law
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: Enrolment in ASMAJ1618. A student must be in third or fourth year.
